title: Garlic Bruschetta
introduction: This classic Garlic Bruschetta hails from the rustic kitchens of Italy, where simple flavors come together to create an unforgettable appetizer. Originally served as a way to sample freshly pressed olive oil in regions like Umbria and Tuscany, this dish highlights the fragrant richness of quality olive oil paired with toasted Italian bread, fresh garlic, and a sprinkle of salt. Ideal for enjoying with a glass of wine, it's as perfect in its simplicity as it is satisfying.
ingredients: Fine sea salt or kosher salt (optional)
instructions: Place a barbecue grill or broiler rack about 5 inches away from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler. Toast the bread on one side until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn the bread and toast the other side, about 2 minutes.
Immediately rub the bread with a garlic clove. Drizzle generously with oil. Sprinkle with salt, if desired. Serve immediately.
